keyConcepts.title: Key Concepts of the Alligator Indicator

jaw.title: Alligator’s Jaw (Blue Line):
jaw.desc: A 13-period moving average smoothed by 8 periods, reflecting the long-term market direction.

teeth.title: Alligator’s Teeth (Red Line):
teeth.desc: An 8-period moving average smoothed by 5 periods, aligning with the medium-term trend.

lips.title: Alligator’s Lips (Green Line):
lips.desc: A 5-period moving average smoothed by 3 periods; faster to react and represents short-term movement.

behavior.title: Alligator’s Behavior in the Market
behavior.intro: The Alligator helps visualize market condition and timing of entries/exits:

sleeping.title: Sleeping Alligator:
sleeping.desc: Lines are intertwined; market is ranging/sideways. Many traders wait for clearer direction.

waking.title: Waking Alligator:
waking.desc: Lines start to separate; a new trend may begin. Traders look for entries in the breakout direction.

feeding.title: Feeding Alligator:
feeding.desc: Lines fan out strongly; trend is established. Many traders hold positions during this phase.

sated.title: Sated Alligator:
sated.desc: Lines converge again; momentum fades. Consider taking profits or preparing for reversal/consolidation.

identify.title: Identify the Trend:
identify.desc: Wide, aligned lines suggest a strong trend; intertwined lines suggest consolidation.

enter.title: Enter When It Wakes Up:
enter.desc: Use the initial separation as an entry signal in the direction of emerging trend.

hold.title: Hold During Feeding:
hold.desc: As separation widens, many traders hold to capture the trending move.

exit.title: Exit When It Falls Asleep:
exit.desc: Convergence indicates waning momentum; consider exiting or tightening risk.

combine.title: Combining the Alligator Strategy with Other Indicators

fractals.title: Fractals:
fractals.desc: Use Williams Fractals to mark potential reversal points and confirm entries/exits.

momentum.title: Momentum Indicators:
momentum.desc: RSI or MACD can confirm trend strength alongside Alligator alignment.

volume.title: Volume Analysis:
volume.desc: Higher volume on breakouts supports the 'waking' phase and trend validity.

example.title: Example of the Alligator Strategy in Action
example.p1: After a consolidation where Jaw, Teeth and Lips are intertwined, the Lips cross above Teeth and Jaw and the lines begin to separate, signaling a potential bullish trend.
example.p2: As the spread widens (feeding phase), a long position is held. When lines converge again, consider exiting to secure profits before a possible reversal.

prosCons.title: Pros and Cons of the Alligator Strategy

clarity.title: Clear Trend Signals:
clarity.desc: Easy visualization of phases for entries/exits.

timeframes.title: Works Across Timeframes:
timeframes.desc: Useful for forex, stocks and commodities on multiple horizons.

compatible.title: Compatible with Other Tools:
compatible.desc: Pairs well with Fractals and momentum indicators.

lag.title: Lags in Fast Markets:
lag.desc: Smoothed MAs can delay signals in high volatility.

false.title: False Signals in Ranges:
false.desc: Whipsaws may occur in low-volatility, sideways conditions.

chart.title: Chart Example
chart.p1: An ideal setup shows the three lines tight (consolidation), then fanning out as the trend begins.
chart.p2: During 'waking'/'feeding' phases, entries and holds are favored; convergence suggests taking profits or caution.
